Click on labels in the image

Alternative forms[edit]

  • Färbe, Farb (dated; obsolete in formal prose)

Etymology[edit]

From Old High German farawa, from Proto-Germanic *farwō.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ˈfaʁbə/ (standard)
  • IPA(key): /ˈfaːbə/ (common, especially northern and central Germany)
  • audio
    		(file)

Noun[edit]

Farbe f (genitive Farbe, plural Farben)

  1. color; colour
  2. paint
  3. dye, colourant for hair
  4. suit (playing cards)
  5. (heraldry) tincture

Declension[edit]

Declension of Farbe
singularplural
indef.def.noundef.noun
nominativeeinedieFarbedieFarben
genitiveeinerderFarbederFarben
dativeeinerderFarbedenFarben
accusativeeinedieFarbedieFarben
  • In obsolete usage the genitive and dative singular could take the form der Farben alternatively to der Farbe.
